content: Yes, pieces from the Renaissance period, including the ones I mentioned, have been used in a variety of modern movies and TV shows. For example, Josquin des Prez's "Ave Maria" can be heard in the 2006 movie "The Queen," while Palestrina's "Sicut Cervus" is featured in the 2016 film "Moonlight." Byrd's "Sing Joyfully unto God" was used in the 2010 movie "The King's Speech" as well as in the TV series "The Tudors." These pieces, along with other Renaissance music, continue to be a source of inspiration for modern filmmakers and composers.
